intro: Uvariodendron letestui, commonly known as the Kivu mallow, is a flowering plant native to the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest understories and has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous small, smooth seeds. Uvariodendron letestui is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution in the region.
